text: hello everyone my name is Emma Doyle and
I am in the sixth grade I want to tell
you about my passion baking and cake
decorating I started to get interested
in baking cake decorating while watching
TV shows like ace of cakes cake boss and
other baking and decorating challenges I
was fascinated at what people can do
with cakes and how amazing and creative
one can be with cake decorating at first
I started by just trying to bacon frost
cakes they were very messy and not the
most attractive but I kept on baking my
parents could see that I really enjoyed
baking so they wanted to make sure I was
safe in the kitchen my dad taught me how
to use a fire extinguisher in case of
any accidental fires and my mom taught
me how to work the oven and how to
handle hot items my first serious cake
was a broken leg cake my grandma had
broken her leg in the previous year so
on the anniversary of her broken leg I
made her this cake I thought it would
make her laugh she adored it to make it
i molded rice krispie treats into the
shape of a foot and I covered the foot
with strips of my own marshmallow
fondant to make the cast the toes are
made of fondant as well what is funny is
that she kept this foot people might get
a shock if they look in her freezer my
journey to cake decorating has had many
successes and failures but in the
process many good learning experiences
one time I had to make mini cupcakes for
a friend I had never made many cupcakes
before in the midst of doing this I
burnt over 200 cupcakes
before discovering the proper
adjustments in oven temperature and
baking time I was quite frustrated
burning batch after batch of cupcakes
until I realized that I had them in the
oven too long and the temperature too
high once I figured it out I had great
success I have learned a lot from cakes
baking acquires math measurements
conversions and calculations it also
involves science the mixing of different
ingredients and beating and developing
of flavors and lastly you need
creativity I won't lie to you now I love
to learn but I hate school I wish
schools could be more engaging make
learning about creating and more
interactive this is what I and many
others look like while in school it is
born if all you do at school is
memorizing dates and facts for tests and
right after school we go along to the
worst part of all homework no kid likes
homework after six or seven hours of
school they are burnt out and want no
more from my own experience and others
too when state testing time comes around
it seems to be the least stressful week
of the whole year because there is no
homework to me it's a kid's paradise in
addition to learning from YouTube videos
and the internet I wanted to get
hands-on lessons in cake decorating kids
classes are just too easy and only
involved some frosting and sprinkles I
wanted to challenge myself take an adult
course or i could learn new and advanced
techniques my mom and i began to think
and decided i could handle an adult
class we got special permission to take
the class and i learned a lot but at
first it was very intimidating being in
a room full of adult strangers but
before long they realized my focus and
see that I could keep up and make
beautiful cakes to this is the cake that
I made at my class it has 72 handmade
calla lilies on it it took me one day to
complete and a week to dry but then I
got to assemble it at my class before
taking the class I tried to make the
calla lilies on my own it took me the
same amount of time to make too
unattractive calla lilies as it took me
to make 72 beautiful calla lilies
whenever I'm asked to make a cake I try
to think of a theme or something that
reflects the person designing a cake
allows me to be very creative here are
some of the cakes that I've made over
the years this is a Reese's Pieces cake
that I made for my sister's soccer coach
Travis for his birthday he loves Reese's
Pieces my good friend Marla really loves
shoes so I decided to make her a cake
she would love I designed to shoot
myself and it is entirely edible out of
fondant and gum paste it is sitting on
top of the cake that has shaped like a
shoebox one time I was asked to make a
wedding cake for two chefs I had an idea
of doing a pot of stew cake with
vegetables made of sugar all around it I
thought it would be important to add
their own recipe for a happy marriage
the recipe for a happy marriage is three
cups of kindness one gallon of patience
one cup of encouragement two quarts of
consideration and 1 tablespoon of faith
and trust and it serves to for a
lifetime my really good friend Hannah
recently turned 13 so for her Bat
Mitzvah I made of this cake the theme of
her party was New York City so I decided
to incorporate the New York City skyline
the Statue of Liberty a taxi cab and
many other important points of interests
throughout New York I had a lot of fun
making these cakes
I think it would be great if schools in
the future would allow kids to explore
what makes them excited and interested I
think it would help kids find their
passions in closing I would like to say
cake baking and decorating makes me feel
special it is a sweet purpose I hope you
find your journey to purpose thank you
